The Chapter with Kuṇḍadhāna
Mahākaccāna’s Birth Story
“The Lord Padumuttara’s
cetiya named Paduma;
Having made a stone seat,
I covered it with gold.
And a parasol made of jewels,
and a fan of yāña leaves;
I placed on the Buddha,
the kinsman of the world, the Tathāgata.
As many gods as there were on earth,
all gathered together then;
The one who will tell the result 🔽of the parasol made of jewels.
We will all listen to that,
as the Teacher tells it;
We will generate even more joy,
in the Dispensation of the Fully Awakened One.
Sitting on a golden seat,
the self-made, foremost person;
Surrounded by the Community of monks,
he spoke these verses:
‘Since this seat was given,
made of gold and jewels;
I will praise him,
listen to me as I speak.
For thirty eons, the Lord of the Gods

Gotama, the light of the world,

I was born into a wealthy family,
